result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor J. Pucel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Victor J. Pucel is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Victor J. Pucel was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.

Count one dismissed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor J. Pucel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: filed by Attorney Richard A. Coad.

Defendant Victor J. Pucel in court with attorney Richard A Coad.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 2. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: $579.00 fine, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts.  Court granted 5 days jail credit. Count 1 dismissed.  Posted bond applied.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 9, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
14 FO 555 is to track with this case per Jordan and Jane
Defendant may travel to Durango CO from Feb. 6th through Feb. 12, 2015
Atty. Coad requests out-of-state travel for the defendant from Feb. 6th to Feb. 12, 2015 - faxed

Defendant Victor J. Pucel in court with attorney Richard A Coad.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waived reading of information.  Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bond continued.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List with Petition for Leave to file Additional Motions filed by DA Kohlwey
for Discovery and Inspection filed by Attorney Richard Coad

Defendant Victor J. Pucel in court with attorney Richard A Coad.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Arraignment scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

standard felony conditions, no contact w/J.C., her residence, workplace, or family, no contact w/K.G., his residence, workplace, or family, no firearms in possession, if defendant has any, to be turned over to law enforcement, not possess/consume alcoholic beverages

Defendant Victor J. Pucel in court, in custody by video with attorney Richard A Coad.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. waives reading of complaint, RIght to Atty recited, $500.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions, no contact w/J.C., her residence, workplace, or family, no contact w/K.G., his residence or workplace or family, no firearms in possession, if he has any, to be turned over to law enforcement, not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, waives time limits to prelim,  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Hearing scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
